description: The course will begin with a historiographical orientation to create a better understanding of Indian society and culture within the given time frame. It will focus equally on Indian perception of Islam and Islamic perception of India. In this context it will examine the theory of kingship in the Indo-Muslim State, the status non-Muslims in Sultanete and Moghal India. The course will also provide an overview of customs, tradition, culture in those times. It proposes focus on the role of Sufism and the Bhakti movement and their effects on religion and society. We will briefly examine manners and morals as depicted in the contemporary literature of the times. We will probably study some extracts from original sources to add meaningfulness and authenticity to our inquiry.
name: ADV READINGS PERSIAN
